text: The C.V. Starr East Asian Library is a library at Columbia University, holding collections for the study of East Asia in the United States. It consists of over one million volumes of Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Tibetan, Mongolian, Manchu, and Western-language materials and almost 7,500 periodical titles, and extensive special collections. It was established in 1902. == References == == External links == * Category:Columbia University campus Category:Library buildings completed in 1902 Category:Libraries in Manhattan Category:University and college academic libraries in the United States Category:1902 establishments in New York (state)
title: C.V. Starr East Asian Library
